Dear Kathleen Nikesch:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
2/13/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Three of the three foster home special evaluations reviewed did not include
adequate documentation to indicate the foster care worker with children in the home
were given a copy of the special evaluation report.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who
have children placed in the home must be notified there
is a corrective action plan and what is required of the
foster parent in that plan.
One of the three foster home special evaluations reviewed included a corrective
action plan. There was no indication the foster care worker with children in the
home was given a copy of the corrective action plan or notified of the expectations
included in the plan as required by this rule.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during the licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency renewal evaluation was completed 11/20/2023 with one
noncompliance identified. The noncompliance was for 327(6)(b). The CAP for this
noncompliance was approved 11/28/2023. This was not identified in
noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the renewal evaluation and
the progress in maintaining compliance with the corrective action plan that was a
part of the renewal evaluation.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified one safety alert.
Safety Alert #1: One home needed a door alarm for the door leading out to a hot tub.
2

Resolution: A door alarm was installed, and the corrective action was approved
08/26/2024 by DCWL.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
